.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Foundation.NSObject GetRowController(valuetype System.nint index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the row.
Docs.summary: Gets the row controller object for the specified row.
Docs.returns: An object whose fields represent elements within the specified row.
Docs.related: Row controller discussion in WatchKit Table Control article

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void InsertRows (Foundation.NSIndexSet rowIndexes, string rowType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InsertRows(class Foundation.NSIndexSet rowIndexes, string rowType) cil managed

Docs.param: The indices at which to add the new rows.
The storyboard identifier associated with the row controller type.
Docs.summary: Adds rows to the table associated with a row controller with the specified .

remarks.para: The must match the Identifier value associated with the row controller in the storyboard.
Unlike iOS, rows are not virtualized. Apple recommends that Watch apps use fewer than 20 rows.

Docs.param: The index of the row to be displayed. Values less than zero will scroll to the top, values greater than row count will scroll to the bottom.

Docs.param: The number of rows desired in the table.
The storyboard identifier associated with the row controller type.
Docs.summary: Sets the total number of rows in the table, all of which are associated with a row controller with the specified ..

remarks.para: The must match the Identifier value associated with the row controller in the storyboard.
Unlike iOS, rows are not virtualized. Apple recommends that Watch apps use fewer than 20 rows.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetRowTypes (string[] rowTypes);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetRowTypes(string[] rowTypes) cil managed

Docs.param: An array equal to the total number of rows in the table. The values are the storyboard identifier(s) associated with the row controller type.
Docs.summary: Populates the table with rows whose types are specified in .

remarks.para: This method will remove any existing rows from the table prior to populating the table.
